description: Cognitive neuroscience investigates the biological bases of higher order cognition and
complex human behavior (or more simply put, how the brain enables the mind). Discussion
topics include the methodologies of cognitive neuroscience, perception, attention,
learning, memory, language, executive function, emotion, development, social cognition,
and consciousness. Offered annually. Also counts toward neuroscience
and linguistics concentrations. Prerequisites: PSYCH 230, or PSYCH 238 and NEURO 239.
